body:
Hello All, 
 
On Apr 7, 2010, at 10:49 PM, Jeremy Huddleston wrote: 
 
> There is a bug in your remote mesa. 
> See https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=24226 
> 
> 
> You should be able to do it via: 
> LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT=1 glxgears 
 
do you mean to set a shell environment variable 
%> setenv LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT 1 
then 
%> glxgears 
 
> That works for me. 
 
This still gives me the heinous error: 
 
X Error of failed request: BadAlloc (insufficient resources for operation) 
 Major opcode of failed request: 147 (GLX) 
 Minor opcode of failed request: 3 (X_GLXCreateContext) 
 Serial number of failed request: 19 
 Current serial number in output stream: 21 
 
 
My remote linux machine is running CentOS 5.4 with everything up-to-date via yum. Would you recommend filing a bug report with the developers of mesa and hope that some day it trickles down to RHEL and then to CentOS? Or should I build my own mesa? And just to clarify, this is NOT an X11 problem right? 
 
Thanks, 
Scott _______________________________________________
